oai_dc:dc.dc:title: James Marsh Morey
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Head and shoulders portrait of James Marsh Morey wearing coat, vest, tie, and high collar. Board mounted sepia photograph.
Morey served as a corporal in the 32nd Tennessee Infantry Regiment. He was captured by Sherman's men in Georgia in 1865 and sent to the prison camp at Hart's Island, New York.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Chickamauga, Battle of, Ga., 1863; Franklin, Battle of, Franklin, Tenn., 1864; Confederate States of America--History; United States--History--Civil War, 1861-1865
Portraits; Vests; Neckties
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Hull & Rankin, Greeneville, Tennessee
